title: Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern as the Grinches Who Almost Steal Christmas...
review: The overwhelming success of " Home Alone " ( it spawned two sequels ) , is enough to guarantee that most people will love this story of a family that departs for Paris on the Christmas holidays , mistakenly leaving an eight - year old boy to fend for himself .

review: And fend he does , when burglars threaten to break in unless he can rig enough booby - traps to keep them out .

review: The laughs are steady , the color photography is great

title: Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern as the Grinches Who Almost Steal Christmas...
review: and the slight story is probably every boy"s fantasy of what it might be like to be left home alone .

review: Add to that the holiday flavor of Christmas and a pleasant musical score by John Williams and you have the makings of a classic .

review: In the Eighties , John Hughes churned out a handful of movies

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: and scored many , many hits .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: Quite rightly , as most of them were seriously funny - I"m DEFINITELY not referring to Curly Sue , so relax ! In one particular scene from Uncle Buck , Macaulay Culkin interrogates a babysitter through the letterbox to make sure she"s not a baddie .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: This inspired Hughes to write a whole new movie .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: Who would have known that this and its sequel would go on to become two of the biggest hits of all time ? Both Hughes and Chris Columbus seem to prefer setting their movies during the holiday season ( Gremlins , Planes , Trains & Automobiles , Christmas Vacation ) and manage to pull them off without too much sentiment , or sickening amounts of gooey love .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: There are two reasons why Home Alone was such a big success .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: The first is that it"s about a kid who outsmarts grown - ups , something that happens every day , only there"s a worldwide conspiracy of silence .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: This movie yells it out loud and clear .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: The second is John Williams"s magical score , which elevates the movie way above slapstick family fare to something more serious and regarded .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: It was nominated for an Academy Award , along with the Christmas carol Somewhere In My Memory ,

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: but lost to John Barry"s Dances with Wolves .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: Damn ! In a mad rush to the airport one morning , the MacCallister family forget one little thing ... Kevin ( Culkin ) .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: He is an eight - year - old kid who wants nothing better than a peaceful Christmas and some time to himself .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: It"s hard for him to get this when living in a house with seven other people(the exact same house from Planes , Trains And Automobiles , don"t you know0 .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: With the rest of the MacCallisters in Paris , Kevin runs wild doing whatever he wants , eating whatever he wants

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: and watching whatever TV show he wants .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: But there"s one major problem .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: The Wet Bandits , Harry ( Joe Pesci ) and Marv ( Daniel Stern ) , are on the prowl

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: and have knocked off every other house in Kevin"s street . His is next .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: And seeing that he"s man - of - the - house now , he HAS to defend it .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: Using whatever tools are at his disposal ( rusty nails , blow torches , Micro Machines ) he sets up a labyrinth of booby traps , so that the Wets can"t break in .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: Their idiot - proof determination proves to be their downfall , as they are tortured and torn - up upon entering Kevin"s domain .

title: Merry Christmas Ya Filthy Animal!
review: Although this is not the only point of the film , there is an important message that family is what really matters to a child , or to anyone , and having them home for the holidays is better than wandering a huge house all by yourself .

title: Never Gets Old
review: When it comes to enjoying that jolly time of year , there are several movies that must be viewed or else it just isn"t Christmas .

title: Never Gets Old
review: One of those is 1990"s " Home Alone " .

title: Never Gets Old
review: Written and produced by the late , great John Hughes and directed by Chris Columbus , it follows the story of young Kevin McCallister ( Played by Macaulay Culkin , arguably the best child actor since Shirley Temple ) who"s constantly picked on

title: Never Gets Old
review: and looked down upon by his large , extended family but especially by his older and much hated brother , Buzz ( Devin Ratray in what has to be his best role ) .

title: Never Gets Old
review: On the eve of the big family vacation , Kevin lashes out

title: Never Gets Old
review: and gets sent to the attic by his impatient mom ( The talented and ravishing Catherine O"Hara ) and right then Kevin makes the prophetic wish of never seeing his family again .

title: Never Gets Old
review: Little does he know , his wish is about to come true when due to a convenient power outage , his parents " alarm clocks fails to go off

title: Never Gets Old
review: and the result is sheer holiday hell as everybody scrambles like there"s no tomorrow to catch that flight .

title: Never Gets Old
review: Everybody that is , except little Kevin who"s forgotten by everyone and as the title says , is left home alone .

title: Never Gets Old
review: Shock turns to happiness as Kevin realizes his wish has come true .

title: Never Gets Old
review: But it"s not all fun and games as two naughty burglars Harry and Marv ( Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern who give a wonderful performance together as the two bumbling thieves ) are on the rampage in Kevin"s neighborhood .

title: Never Gets Old
review: Rather than running away like most kids might do , Kevin decides to fight back using his creativity and some simple but potentially bone shattering traps .

title: Never Gets Old
review: It all might sound like a simple holiday comedy to be watched and then put away ,

title: Never Gets Old
review: but there"s something more to the film that keeps me and many others coming back year after year .

title: Never Gets Old
review: To be sure , the physical comedy of Harry and Marv getting their asses handed to them by Kevin"s traps is nothing short of a laugh riot ( Traps include anything from heated door handles to slippery steps ) .

title: Never Gets Old
review: But the film also manages to include a lot of heart as Kevin slowly but surely begins to realize that family is what the holidays are all about and without them it"s pretty lonely , a lesson he learns first hand by the at first feared but then loved neighborhood recluse , Old Man Marley ( the late , great character actor Robert Blossom ) .

title: Never Gets Old
review: John Williams score to this is undoubtedly one of his best as it is both grand and yet not overbearing in the least .

title: Never Gets Old
review: On the contrary , it manages to invoke the spirit of Christmas in all of us while giving us the chills because of its beauty .

title: Never Gets Old
review: And of course , who can forget the performance of Macaulay Culkin since the film rests on his shoulders more than anything else .

title: Never Gets Old
review: With his mischievous grin and resourcefulness , we just can"t help

title: Never Gets Old
review: but love his character and root for him all the way through the film .

title: Never Gets Old
review: I should also mention that the movie includes a small but very memorable performance by the legendary John Candy ( Try not to laugh at the conversation he has with Kevin"s mom in the back of the van ! ) .

title: Never Gets Old
review: " Home Alone " is one of those films that no matter how many times you might see it , it just never gets old .

title: Never Gets Old
review: The movie is a time capsule in many ways because it somehow captured not only the holiday spirit but also the magic of the time it was made in , the 90"s , a time where not only were the movies better but so was everything else .

title: Never Gets Old
review: It is for that reason that movie will live on forever and ever , much like the spirit of Christmas itself .

title: Never Gets Old
review: So without further adieu , I urge you to watch this modern classic

title: Never Gets Old
review: and if you"re ever going on big trip with the family , make sure that you have all your children ! Also starring John Heard and a host of other memorable actors .

title: Never Gets Old
review: Merry Christmas everyone ! ! ! ! ! ! !

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Take a cheeky eight - year - old , put him in a situation he has to slapstick his way out of with the kind of antics most cartoon characters wouldn"t survive , and what you have is one of the most wildly popular , commercially successful comedies of all time .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: And when it"s over , though most likely you"ll have had a good time , you"ll be tempted to ask the question : Why ? Because ` Home Alone , " directed by Chris Columbus and written by John Hughes , is mediocre at best , though it does have it"s moments .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: It"s a matter of the filmmakers being very astute , perhaps , and wisely mixing in a potpourri of elements with universal appeal and touching upon that common nerve they calculated would give just about anyone in the audience something to which they could relate .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: And they were right .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Kids , Christmas , family , vacation , independence , a scary situation ; it"s all in here .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: But , interestingly enough , it lacks the sentimental value that would seemingly have made this a movie one could truly embrace .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: As it is , it"s engaging fare ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: but somehow manages to keep the viewer at arm"s length .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Then again , maybe that"s even part of the appeal ; it may be that audiences at this particular time and place were more comfortable just watching without having to invest anything of themselves in order to have a good time .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: This was , after all , 1990 , and this film played to a generation weaned on more than a decade of Saturday Night Live , whose keen sense of biting satire and parody definitely had an influence on the mind - set of audiences everywhere .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: And is that a bad thing ? No , absolutely not .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: It merely points up one possible reason why a film centered around an eight - year - old with a somewhat derisive attitude could be so wholeheartedly received .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Also , it may be that the second half of the film , with it"s over - the - top slapstick , is what made the final impression on the audience .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: And this IS funny stuff ; and it"s going to get to even those who usually prefer humor that doesn"t involve slapstick , because it"s so well done .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Again , credit the filmmakers with having their fingers on the pulse of our culture and standards at the time .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: But you also have to give credit to Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern who bring the ` Wet Bandits , " Harry and Marv , to life ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and know how to put across this kind of comedy , which is no easy task .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: The story itself is simple : The extended McCallister family sets off for a Christmas vacation in Paris ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and inadvertently , Kevin ( Macaulay Culkin ) gets left behind . Left alone . At home .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Where , rising to the occasion beyond anything even the most prodigious teenager could manage , he discovers the thrill of being independent

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and thwarts a pair of bungling burglars in the balance .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Meanwhile , mom and dad ( Catherine O"Hara as Kate , John Heard as Peter ) go out of their minds when they get to Paris

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and discover what has happened .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: If only they knew what an ingenious and imaginative son they had ... Culkin is certainly a cute kid ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: but can he act ? Well , the jury is still out on that one .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: It"s hard to say , since the dialogue he is given is so ridiculously above that of an eight - year - old ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and the situations he encounters are so far - fetched , that there is no real frame of reference by which to consider it objectively .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: His timing and rhythm are lacking , however , that much is clear .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: His responses-- or , if you will , the punch lines he delivers-- are always a beat behind what they should be .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: And it robs the humor of the spontaneity that would have made it funnier , even hilarious .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: As it is , the only real laughs come from Kevin"s assault on the Wet Bandits ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and there are plenty to be had there .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Pesci and Stern become the real stars of the show as they play out their slapstick antics , which are truly deserving of the laughs they generate .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Their expressions of incredulity in the face of the violence that is visited upon them is what makes this movie .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Everything else merely sets the stage for Harry and Marv"s descent into the maelstrom .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: And what Pesci and Stern do here should not be taken for granted , nor taken lightly artistically .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: To put this kind of humor across takes some real talent on the part of consummate professionals ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and Pesci and Stern certainly deliver it .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Their secret ? They play it straight , which keeps the silliness out of it .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Had they played it strictly as farce , it simply wouldn"t have had the same impact ;

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: but by playing to the characters in the situation , rather than to a situation involving characters , it works .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: And , once again , chalk up another one for Columbus and Hughes , who really know how to deliver this kind of material .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: The only truly poignant moment in the film involves Kevin"s encounter with a mysterious neighbor , ` Old Man Marley , " played wonderfully by character actor / poet Roberts Blossom .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: The revelation of his secret earlier in the film sets up the purest moment of the ending ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: and though it is brief , it"s inspired and adds a much needed perspective to the story .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: The supporting cast includes Devin Ratray ( Buzz ) , Angela Goethals ( Linnie ) , Gerry Bamman ( Uncle Frank ) , Hillary Wolf ( Aunt Leslie ) , Ralph Foody ( Gangster Johnny ) , Billie Bird ( Irene ) , Bill Erwin ( Ed ) and John Candy , memorable in the role of Gus Polinski , the Polka Band shuttle Chief .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: Considering the ratio between this movie"s substance and the success it still enjoys today , ` Home Alone " is something of an anomaly in the history of the genre . It lacks insight ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: yet delivers some real belly laughs .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: It lacks a single character the audience can truly embrace ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: yet is accepted overwhelmingly as is .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: It lacks inspiration ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: yet is an inspired film in the way it is crafted and delivered .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: It"s one you"re probably going to like and enjoy ,

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: but upon reflection may wonder , ` Why .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: " And the answer ? Who can say . Go figure .

title: An Anomaly of the Genre
review: It"s the magic of the movies . 6/10 .

title: A Minor Classic
review: John Hughes and Chris Columbus teamed together to bring us one of the biggest box office smashes of 1990 ... A little thing called Home Alone .

title: A Minor Classic
review: A comedy that not only made a lot of money but made a genuine movie star out of the young actor playing the lead role .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Macaulay Culkin lights up the screen as a young man named Kevin McAllister , a young boy who actually gets left behind when his family goes out of town for Christmas .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Surprisingly , Kevin"s realization that his family got a plane without him sits pretty well with him

title: A Minor Classic
review: and he settles into the ultimate kid"s fantasy of having the whole house to himself .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Unfortunately , playtime is cut short when a couple of bumbling thieves ( Joe Pesci , Daniel Stern ) somehow get wind of the fact that Kevin is alone in the house , setting in motion a cartoon - like , cat and mouse game between good kid and the bad crooks that puts the best Tom and Jerry cartoons to shame .

title: A Minor Classic
review: The film"s enjoyment lies in the viewer"s complete acceptance of the premise as a fantasy .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Yes , Kevin is part of a very large family ,

title: A Minor Classic
review: but there is NO way any family would get on a plane to leave the country without double and triple checking to make sure that all the kids are present

title: A Minor Classic
review: and there is also NO way that two grown men couldn"t overpower a child if they wanted to .

title: A Minor Classic
review: If you can check these two large lapses in cinematic logic at the door , the film can be enjoyable .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Yes , the cartoon - violence that occurs between Kevin and the crooks is a little over the top ,

title: A Minor Classic
review: but it is what makes the film so funny .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Culkin charms in the title role and Pesci and Stern work well together as Kevin"s bumbling tormentors .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Mention should also be made of Catherine O"Hara and John Heard as Kevin"s parents , who are very funny in the opening scenes .

title: A Minor Classic
review: Chris Columbus " direction seems to be based on Warner Brothers cartoons ,

title: A Minor Classic
review: but who doesn"t like Warner Brothers cartoons ? So check your brain at the door

title: A Minor Classic
review: and you"ll see why this film was one of the biggest hits of 1990 .

title: Home Alone
review: Home Alone will stand the test of time , methinks .

title: Home Alone
review: Watching it tonight , I just find it too much fun .

title: Home Alone
review: Culkin is certainly a bona fide star here , the groundwork laid in his wonderful work opposite John Candy in the John Hughes - directed , Uncle Buck .

title: Home Alone
review: The plot — as if you didn"t know it , right?—has 8 - year old Culkin ( quite wise beyond his years , if a bit precocious

title: Home Alone
review: and , at times , mischievous ) left accidentally alone while his parents and family go to Paris by plane to visit the father"s brother for the Christmas Holidays .

title: Home Alone
review: He must fend off two cartoonish , oafish burglars ( calling themselves the " wet bandits " ! ! ! ) robbing rich suburban houses on his block , their eyes mainly focused on thieving from his family"s home .

title: Home Alone
review: Pesci and Stern are positively hilarious as the not - so - bright thieves , winding up punished by Culkin"s vast array of traps laid at the house they so desperately want to rob .

title: Home Alone
review: There"s a lot more to the film than just seeing the bandits fall prey to violent traps set by an intelligent kid ; touched on is Culkin"s loneliness without his family , dealing with a scary neighbor ( Roberts Blossom , who is simply delightful ) that has more to him than meets the eye ,

title: Home Alone
review: and a mother"s devoted trip back home to her son .

title: Home Alone
review: Of course , generations of fans will remember Culkin applying aftershave and shrieking

title: Home Alone
review: and the " Filthy Animal " footage scaring both Stern and a pizza delivery boy .

title: Home Alone
review: The visual silhouette trick where Culkin fools Pesci and Stern into believing there was a party taking place is brilliant .

title: Home Alone
review: Terrific casting , with the likes of Catherine O"Hara and John Heard as the parents , and even the smaller parts ( the aforementioned Blossom and John Candy as the leader of a Polka band who offers a rented van ride to O"Hara he and his traveling buddies use to get to a gig in Milwaukee , passing through Chicago on the way ) , only enhance the whole experience .

title: Home Alone
review: While the Raison d"être might seem to be Culkin outsmarting dim - witted , numskull burglars — using violence from a Loony Tunes cartoon to do so — there"s plenty more to enjoy here .

title: Home Alone
review: Personally , I think Culkin as the anchor is one of the chief reasons this film remains so timeless and specialit"s the perfect example of just - right casting .

title: Home Alone
review: " This is my house .

title: Home Alone
review: I have to defend it .

title: Home Alone
review: " After building up some good will throughout , credibility does go out the window ,

title: Home Alone
review: but this final stand between Culkin and the bandits is so highly memorable , I think it"s excusable .

title: Home Alone
review: Plus , despite what we know would * really * happen if these two actually were shot by bb"s from a bb gun , slip on purposely icy steps , get hit in the head with a crowbar , touch a doorknob heated extremely , stepped on a long nail , received an iron to the forehead , tripped ( and landed on ) hotwheels , get a blow torch flame to the top of the head ( ! ! ! ) , step barefoot first onto ornaments ( Yikes ! ) ,

title: Home Alone
review: and take a shot to the face by loaded paint cans ( ! ) , part of the fun is to suspend disbelief and take it all in stride .

review: Stern"s reaction to the spider ( and the iron stamp on his face ) is priceless .

title: Home Alone
review: As is Pesci covered in feathers .

title: Home Alone
review: Stern trying to hit the spider and instead crushing Pesci"s chest only adds to the outrageousness of the final minutes .

review: While I loved and anticipated the finale as a child , with all its Three Stooges violence , I think as an adult , the film prior to this leaves a great deal more of an impression .

review: There"s a lot of heart here , accompanying the pain of picking the wrong house to rob and the wrong kid to antagonize .

review: After Blossom bops the bandits in the heads with an ice shovel , the film pretty much tells you it"s only a movie .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: A little boy ends up " Home Alone " when his family leaves for Paris without him in this 1990 film starring Macauley Culkin , Catherine O"Hara , Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: The family is running late and nearly misses a flight to Paris ; a neighbor boy gets into their van , so when the oldest girl does a head count , all are accounted for .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: Except that little Kevin ( Culkin ) , who was sent to bed early and wishes his family would disappear , isn"t there .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: It"s not until they"re on the plane that his mother ( O"Hara ) realizes that Kevin is missing .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: While she attempts to get back to him , Kevin needs to fend for himself and also protect himself from two robbers ( Pesci and Stern ) who are systematically robbing the neighbors and have Kevin"s house targeted .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: Very funny , often laugh out loud film with Culkin pulling all kinds of pranks to keep the criminals out , from making it look like he"s not alone by queuing up video tapes of crime films and setting booby traps should they break in .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: He also takes the time to talk to a mysterious neighbor ( Roberts Blossom ) who is estranged from his son .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: Mom , meanwhile , ends up in a movers truck with John Candy .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: Culkin is adorable without being cloying ,

title: Fun Christmas film
review: and the movie has a wonderful warmth about it as well .

title: Fun Christmas film
review: Not the type of thing I"d normally enjoy ,

title: Fun Christmas film
review: but I sure enjoyed this one .

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: Luckily , this movie is made for everyone ! For a basic plot summary , " Home Alone " sees young Kevin McCalister ( Macaulay Culkin ) waking up a few days before Christmas in a completely empty house , his extremely large and rather disorganized family having left him behind on their trip overseas .

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: While the family tries to get back home , Kevin must outwit a pair of two - bit thieves ( played by Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern ) who want nothing more than to loot his home .

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: What really makes this film special is the wide appeal of the humor .

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: One could literally sit down with the entire family ( from young to old )

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: and watch this movie , and everyone would be laughing all the way through .

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: From young Kevin"s attempts at " holding down the fort " , to the bumbling burglars played brilliantly by two veteran actors , this is the type of movie that you will be quoting long after the TV is turned off .

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: Thus , I highly recommend " Home Alone " to quite literally anyone , especially during the Christmas season .

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: If you have a list of " Must - See " holiday movies , this one should be right next to Frosty , " Wonderful Life " ,

title: "I Made My Family Disappear"
review: and claymation Rudolph !

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: Too bad for John Hughes , my favorite writer of the 80s .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: His first offering of the 90s was this blockbuster , not a bad film ,

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: but one that started him on an unfortunate trend .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: The storyline is ingenuis if you"re trying to lure kids to see it ,

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: and releasing it during the holiday season made it an easy option for parents who wanted something PG rated for the little ones .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: It concerns Culkin being left behind by his family during a mad dash to the airport .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: When he awakens to an empty house , he stays unrealisticly calm .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: Most kids would probably be scared on their own ,

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: but he"s unphased and makes the best of it , eating junk , jumping on his folks bed and staying up late watching R rated films .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: His family finally notices him missing halfway to Paris and mom O"Hara takes the rest of the films running time to get back to him .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: In the middle of living it up , Culkin discovers that a pair of hairbrained burglars plan on robbing his house .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: He"s ready for them , arming the entire home with an array of painful traps and devices .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: Up until this point the film was slightly amusing , as Culkin , though not a great kid actor , was cute to watch go thru his little adventures .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: But Hughes , writing genius that he is , waited till the end to hatch his goldmine idea that he knew kids would eat up .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: Youngsters , most of which who don"t understand prolonged pain and find it funny , lapped up the cartoonish injuries heaped upon Pesci and Stern .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: Watching as an adult , though , it just makes you uncomfortable , watching men scream in pain scene after scene .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: Hughes tries to cancel out the violence with a sappy happy ending ,

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: but it does nothing to erase the damage done by the unpleasantness .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: And as said earlier , because of the 800 million dollar success of the film , Hughes would mire himself in a clone mode for the entire decade of the nineties ! Constantly remaking this formula with even worse results each time .

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: It all went to show that even your best success can not be the best thing for you ,

title: where Hughes went wrong
review: and all we can hope is that real John Hughes who we loved in the 80s will come home again .

title: A great family film!
review: Home Alone is a great family film that is pretty funney ! In the movie Kevin McCallister(Macauly Culkin ) hates being the youngest member of his big family ! On the night before his family plans to take holiday trip to Paris Kevin gets in trouble and is sent to the third floor .

title: A great family film!
review: While there Kevin wishes for his family to disappear

title: A great family film!
review: and in the morning gets his wish as his family leaves in a hurry to get to the airport and leaves Kevin home alone ! Kevin enjoys being home alone but soon feels bad for the way he acted towards them and misses them ! He also learns that two burglars named Harry ( Joe Pesci ) and Marv ( Daniel Stern ) are planning to break into his home and that he must defend his house with traps for the burglars ! My favorite scene in the movie is where Harry and Marv finally meet each other in the house after walking through several of Kevin"s traps and Harry asks Marv Why the hell ya take your shoes off ?

title: A great family film!
review: And Marv asks Harry Why the hell ya dressed like a chicken ? I just died laughing at that scene ! Filled with wonderful laughter and humor Home Alone is a true family movie that the whole family can enjoy ! I laugh every time I see it ! 10 out of 10 !

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: I know that it"s highly unlikely for an 8 - year - old boy , no matter how smart , to have singlehandedly pulled off all those burglar traps ,

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: but I still love this movie ! ! As the youngest child in a big family , Kevin is somewhat spoiled

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: and is consequently seen by his siblings as a pain .

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: The night before the family"s year - end holiday to Paris , he gets sent up to the attic as punishment for fighting with his siblings .

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: Stung by the seeming injustice of it all , Kevin wishes for his family to disappear .

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: Amid the hustle of getting to the airport , his parents forget about him .

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: Kevin is at first delighted that he got his wish ,

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: but soon finds himself having to defend the house against burglars .

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: Home Alone is so funny and Kevin ( Macaulay Culkin ) is so adorable ! It"s one of the few movies that made me laugh out loud .

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: The first half was a bit slow ,

title: Great family comedy for the holidays
review: but it was refreshing to see the world through the eyes of an 8 - year - old - believing the scary tales spun by an older kid and letting your imagination run wild ! The second half where Kevin ordered pizza and played cat and mouse with the burglars was hilarious and just believable .

review: Beyond the humour , I liked the movie for the message that it sent - family is precious ! Truly the perfect family movie for the holidays !

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: " Home Alone " has been one of the most cherished and beloved Christmas movies since its release 14 years ago ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: and nearly every time it runs on television around the holidays , I feel obligated to watch it , to " get in the mood " for the yuletide season .

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: This is a wonderful family comedy that everyone can enjoy , if they open their hearts and minds .

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: Kevin McCallister is ungrateful towards his family , who treats him like he is invisible ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: and wakes up one morning to discover that he has " made his family disappear " .

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: Actually , his family unawaringly abandoned him when they hastily left to spend Christmas in Paris .

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: This puts the clever , mischievous , and industrial Kevin in the position of being " home alone " ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: and he plans to make the very best of this long desired vacation from his family- in jumping on the bed , watching obscene , violent movies , indulging in rotten food , and riding down the stairs in a sleigh- perhaps every child"s dream come true .

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: All is fun and games , that is , until he discovers two ominous crooks by the name of Harry and Marv , who deviously plot to steal from residents of Kevin"s neighborhood , including his own house ! Now this becomes a matter of out - witting and thwarting the two crooks through a series of clever , contrived traps and gags which will discourage Harry and Marve"s criminal efforts and leave them with splitting headaches , sores throughout their bodies ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: and eventually , a pair of cold , steel handcuffs ! This is such a wonderful , delightful premise , perfect for holiday viewing , regardless of age ( admittedly , however , this film was better when I was very young ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: and even inspirational- this is how you stop " the bad guys " ) .

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: It also contains some valuable morals , as Keven learns through his experiences and acquaintances in being " home alone " : never wish for your family to disappear , for once they are gone , you will be praying for their return ; don"t prejudge others based on their appearances and " rumors " : Kevin is at first petrified of a man who is believed to be a " shovel murderer " ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: yet once he becomes acquainted with him , the man is harmless , genial , and kind ; and finally , when you recognize a threat being posed to yourself and others , don"t stand around , but take immediate action ( of course , one can not be nearly as devisive as Kevin in " Home Alone " ) ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: but you get the picture .

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: " Home Alone " is a wonderful , clever , funny , and entertaining Christmas classic , featuring an enchanting musical score by John Williams , some hilarious , if inane , dialogue , a solid MacCauley Culkin performance ( the finest of his career ) ,

title: Quintessential Christmas Movie
review: and some very endearing qualities that always make this the quintessential Christmas watch .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: With a simple plot , great acting , and slapstick out the wazoo , Home Alone is an indispensable movie , not to mention the film that launched Macaulay Culkin to stardom .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: Like previously stated , the plot is simple .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: Kevin McAllister ( Culkin ) is an 8 - year old kid , the youngest in a rather large family , and he hates it .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: For those of us who grew up in huge families , we can identify with Kevin when he shouts , " When I grow up

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: and get married , I"m living alone ! Did you hear me ? I"M LIVING ALONE ! " That night , after ruining his family"s dinner ( of course , he was provoked by his older brother ) , Kevin wishes that his family would disappear .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: The next morning , Kevin gets his wish .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: While he thinks his family has just completely disappeared , little does he know that they left early for Paris

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: and miscounted ( they mistook the next - door neighbor kid as him ) .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: Realizing now is his chance to do whatever he wants , Kevin has the time of his life : going through his brother"s room , jumping on the bed , watching R - rated movies , the works .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: However , Kevin is smarter than he looks ,

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: and notices that two moronic burglars ( played perfectly by Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern ) have been snooping around his house .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: When he overhears them deciding to rob the house on Christmas Eve , he pulls together some of the most complex and elaborate booby - traps that would be the envy of professional snipers .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: The audience roots for the endless slapstick , laughing even harder as the burglars get more and more determined to find Kevin and get rid of him .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: While this is going on , Kevin"s mom ( Catherine O"Hara ) is trying desperately to get home and make sure her son is OK .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: Home Alone is proof that American audiences love to see the bad guys get the snot kicked out of them .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: With paint cans in the face , tacks up the foot , broken glass on the floor , heads getting set on fire , and trips galore , we just can"t stop laughing .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: Of course , the moving also has heart , including a sweet reunion with Kevin & his family , plus his friendship to a street shoveler .

title: Who doesn't remember this?
review: I recommend this movie to anyone . 10/10 .
